title: Welcome!
text:
I am an assistant professor in the political science department at the University of Nevada, Reno. I study American political behavior, with research interests in deliberation, political discussion, and political psychology. I have additional research interests in state and local politics, and women and politics. I also study political methodology, with specific interests in experiments and social network analysis. My work has been published in the American Journal of Political Science, the Journal of Experimental Political Science, and PS: Political Science and Politics.
I am co-director of the Nevada Election Survey Project, which conducts original surveys of Nevadans about their political and policy views.

title: Media
text:
I have been featured in many local, state, and national media outlets. Here, I offer a sample of these stories.






“Don’t Go Down the Rabbit Hole,” Charlie Warzel, The New York Times, February 18, 2021




“Face the State: Primary Post Mortem,” 2 News, June 23, 2022.
